Intel ® Integrated Performance Primitives
USC G723.1 codec

Overview
USC Codec description
 

Overview

The USC G723.1 speech codec is compliant with ITU-T G.723.1 and Annex A specifications for Dual-Rate speech coder promoted by International Telecommunication Union ( www.itu.org ) and has been implemented using the Intel ® Integrated Performance Primitives (Intel ® IPP) Speech Coding functions. The USC G723.1 codec supports 16bit narrowband 8000 Hz PCM signal compression and decompression with 30ms frame length at 5300 and 6300 bps producing 158 and 189 bits per frame (bpf) respectively.

Additional information on this software as well as other Intel ® Software Development Products is available at http://developer.intel.com/software/products/ .

USC Codec description

For USC Interface description refer to USC manual. 

 

USC G723.1 codec parameters:

  • Codec name: IPP_G723.1

  • Compression algorithm: Multipulse Maximum Likelihood Quantization (MP-MLQ) for 6.3 kbps and Algebraic-Code-Excited Linear-Prediction (ACELP) for 5.3 kbps.

  • Linkage: USC_G723_Fxns

  • Sampling: 16bit linear 8000 Hz

  • Frame: 30ms

  • Bitrates: 5300 bps (159 bpf) and 6300 bps (189 bpf); SID - 32 bpf, Untransmitted - 8 bpf.

  • Voice Activity Detection: VAD supported

  • Packet Loss Concealment: PLC supported

  • Frame type (value): Good (0), Bad (1)

  • Standard: ITU-T G.723.1, Annex A
